snippet: The reduction, representing about 5 percent of the work force, is part of the group’s efforts to focus on Airbus, its commercial airplane business, and pare its military unit.
abstract: European Aeronautic Defense and Space, parent company of Airbus, announces plans to cut 5,800 jobs from its military and space divisions over next three years as it responds to reductions in European military budgets driven by austerity measures; cuts represent about 5 percent of work force.
lead_paragraph: The reduction, representing about 5 percent of the work force, is part of the group’s efforts to focus on Airbus, its commercial airplane business, and pare its military unit.

headline.main: Parent of Airbus to Cut 5,800 Jobs as Europe’s Military Budgets Shrink
headline.print_headline: Parent of Airbus to Cut 5,800 Jobs as Europe’s Military Budgets Shrink

keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
keywords.name: organizations
